verses.verse: And it came<WH1961> about when<WH9201> Samuel<WH8050> was old<WH2204> that he appointed<WH7760> his sons<WH1121> judges<WH8199> over Israel.<WH3478>
Now the name<WH8034> of his first-born was Joel,<WH3100> and the name<WH8034> of his second,<WH4932> Abijah;<WH29> [they] were judging<WH8199> in Beersheba.<WH884>

His sons,<WH1121> however, did not walk<WH1980> in his ways,<WH1870> but turned<WH5186> aside<WH5186> after<WH310> dishonest<WH1215> gain<WH1215> and took<WH3947> bribes<WH7810> and perverted<WH5186> justice.<WH4941>
Then all<WH3605> the elders<WH2205> of Israel<WH3478> gathered<WH6908> together and came<WH935> to Samuel<WH8050> at Ramah;<WH7414>

and they said<WH559> to him, "Behold,<WH2009> you have grown<WH2204> old,<WH2204> and your sons<WH1121> do not walk<WH1980> in your ways.<WH1870> Now<WH6258> appoint<WH7760> a king<WH4428> for us to judge<WH8199> us like all<WH3605> the nations.<WH1471>"

But the thing<WH1697> was displeasing<WH7489> in the sight<WH5869> of Samuel<WH8050> when<WH9201> they said,<WH559> "Give<WH5414> us a king<WH4428> to judge<WH8199> us." And Samuel<WH8050> prayed<WH6419> to the Lord.<WH3068>

And the Lord<WH3068> said<WH559> to Samuel,<WH8050> "Listen<WH8085> to the voice<WH6963> of the people<WH5971> in regard to all<WH3605> that they say<WH559> to you, for they have not rejected<WH3988> you, but they have rejected<WH3988> Me from being<WH4427> king<WH4427> over<WH5921> them.

"Like all<WH3605> the deeds<WH4639> which<WH834> they have done<WH6213> since<WH4480> the day<WH3117> that I brought<WH5927> them up from Egypt<WH4714> even to this<WH2088> day<WH3117> – in that they have forsaken<WH5800> Me and served<WH5647> other<WH312> gods<WH430> – so<WH3651> they are doing<WH6213> to you also.<WH1571>

"Now<WH6258> then, listen<WH8085> to their voice;<WH6963> however,<WH389> you shall solemnly<WH5749> warn<WH5749> them and tell<WH5046> them of the procedure<WH4941> of the king<WH4428> who<WH834> will reign<WH4427> over<WH5921> them."
So Samuel<WH8050> spoke<WH559> all<WH3605> the words<WH1697> of the Lord<WH3068> to the people<WH5971> who had asked<WH7592> of him a king.<WH4428>

And he said,<WH559> "This<WH2088> will be the procedure<WH4941> of the king<WH4428> who<WH834> will reign<WH4427> over<WH5921> you: he will take<WH3947> your sons<WH1121> and place<WH7760> [them] for himself in his chariots<WH4818> and among his horsemen<WH6571> and they will run<WH7323> before<WH6440> his chariots.<WH4818>

"And he will appoint<WH7760> for himself commanders<WH8269> of thousands<WH505> and of fifties,<WH2572> and [some] to do<WH9177> his plowing<WH2758> and to reap<WH7114> his harvest<WH7105> and to make<WH6213> his weapons<WH3627> of war<WH4421> and equipment<WH3627> for his chariots.<WH7393>
"He will also take<WH3947> your daughters<WH1323> for perfumers<WH7548> and cooks<WH2879> and bakers.<WH644>
"And he will take<WH3947> the best<WH2896> of your fields<WH7704> and your vineyards<WH3754> and your olive<WH2132> groves,<WH2132> and give<WH5414> [them] to his servants.<WH5650>
"And he will take<WH6237> a tenth<WH6237> of your seed<WH2233> and of your vineyards,<WH3754> and give<WH5414> to his officers<WH5631> and to his servants.<WH5650>

"He will also take<WH3947> your male<WH5650> servants<WH5650> and your female<WH8198> servants<WH8198> and your best<WH2896> young<WH970> men<WH970> and your donkeys,<WH2543> and use<WH6213> [them] for his work.<WH4399>
"He will take<WH6237> a tenth<WH6237> of your flocks,<WH6629> and you yourselves<WH9043> will become<WH1961> his servants.<WH5650>

"Then you will cry<WH2199> out in that day<WH3117> because<WH4480> <WH6440> of your king<WH4428> whom<WH834> you have chosen<WH977> for yourselves, but the Lord<WH3068> will not answer<WH6030> you in that day.<WH3117>"
Nevertheless, the people<WH5971> refused<WH3985> to listen<WH8085> to the voice<WH6963> of Samuel,<WH8050> and they said,<WH559> "No,<WH3808> but there shall be a king<WH4428> over<WH5921> us,
that we also<WH1571> may be like all<WH3605> the nations,<WH1471> that our king<WH4428> may judge<WH8199> us and go<WH3318> out before<WH6440> us and fight<WH3898> our battles.<WH4421> "
Now after Samuel<WH8050> had heard<WH8085> all<WH3605> the words<WH1697> of the people,<WH5971> he repeated<WH1696> them in the Lord's hearing.<WH241>

And the Lord<WH3068> said<WH559> to Samuel,<WH8050> "Listen<WH8085> to their voice,<WH6963> and appoint<WH4427> them a king.<WH4428>" So Samuel<WH8050> said<WH559> to the men<WH376> of Israel,<WH3478> "Go<WH1980> every<WH376> man<WH376> to his city.<WH5892>"
